series_description: This series documents investigations of complaints made by public on issues such as quality and contamination of water, well pollution, and presence of lead. This series may include, but is not limited to: complaint letters, investigation notes, decisions, reports, and responses.

This series documents compliance actions and public notifications pertaining to the operation of a public waterworks. This series may include, but is not limited to: documents describing significant deficiencies or sanitary defects, disinfection byproduct (DBP) operation evaluation level (OEL) reports, corrective action plans, Revised Total Coliform Rule (RTCR) assessments, public notices, and certification documents

This series documents various types of enforcement actions taken with respect to waterworks that do not meet the contained in the Virginia Waterworks Regulations. This series may include, but is not limited to: Notices of Alleged Violation issued by the Office of Drinking Water (ODW); warning letters; enforcement meeting records and related correspondence; Office of the Attorney General/Environmental Protection (OAG/EPA) referrals; binding schedules; EPA notices of violation; and administrative orders with or without consent, to include special orders and court orders

This series documents involvement in interagency consultation on state highway projects and other types of construction projects that might affect drinking water, federally endangered or threatened species, designated trout streams, or anadromous fish streams. This series may include, but is not limited to: water quality permits, permit modifications, maps, photographs, and geological assessment records

This series documents contribution to environmental reviews done for groups such as State Environmental Review Process (SERP), Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ), towns, municipalities, cities, and land trusts. This series may include, but is not limited to: comment letters, relevant documents from the application, and maps

series_title: Financial and Construction Assistance Programs (FCAP): Leveraged Projects
series_description: This series documents bonds and projects funded by those bonds associated with the Financial Construction Assistance Programs (FCAP) and Drinking Water State Revolving Fund (DWSRF) Program. This series may include, but is not limited to: bond information, applications, expenditure reports, certification documents, program design manuals, project schedules, cash flow documents, final project evaluations, drawings, maps, operating agreements, intended use plans, and annual audited financial statements

series_title: Financial and Construction Assistance Programs (FCAP): Leveraged Projects
series_description: This series documents management of multiple funding under the Drinking Water State Revolving Fund (DWSRF) Program, including but not limited to the the Financial and Construction Assistance Programs (FCAP) and Training and Capacity Development Program. This series may include, but not limited to: applications, expenditure reports, certification documents, program design manuals, project schedules, cash flow documents, final project evaluations, drawings, maps, operating agreements, task orders, business plans, planning documents, intended use plans, and annual audited financial statements
This series documents required bacteriological and chemical sampling done by owners of waterworks. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, related calculations, and determinations

series_title: Lead and Copper Rule: Facility Closed or Records
series_description: This series documents actions taken for the Lead and Copper Rule (LCR), including source water sampling; LCR sample invalidation; 90th percentile lead and copper concentrations; non-first-draw samples, locations, and standing times; in water sources and treatment; corrosion control treatment requirements; lead service line replacement; and public education programs. These records are retained until they are either superseded or the facility closes. This series may but is not limited to: determinations and decisions, notification letters, monitoring waivers, and consumer notice of lead This series does not include the Material Survey and Plan or the results of first-draw samples

This series documents the scheduling of required sampling by waterworks owners for various contaminants. This series may include, but is not limited to: monitoring schedules entered in the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS). 40 142.14(d)(5)

This series documents the permitting, design, and construction of waterworks to ensure the facility meets the requirements of the Virginia Waterworks Regulations and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). These records are retained until the facility is razed. This series may include but is not limited to: construction permits, description sheets, well and Drawdown, review notes, and plans for Surface Water Treatment Plant/Groundwater Under the Direct Influence of Surface Water (SWTP/GUDI)

This series documents the permitting, design, and construction of waterworks to ensure the facility meets the requirements of the Virginia Waterworks Regulations and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). This series may include, but is not limited to: master plans, Capital Improvement Program (CIP) documents, design reports, change orders, addenda, Preliminary Engineering Reports (PERs), general sections of specifications, review notes, and plans for groundwater (GW) sources/treatment and distribution systems

This series documents interaction with the Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) and other state and local to grant environmental permits, such as Virginia Pollution Abatement (VPA), Surface Water Withdrawal Permits, Groundwater Withdrawal Permits, Virginia Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (VPDES), Virginia Water Protection Applications/Permit (VWP), and septic permits. This series include, but is not limited to: permits, correspondence, memoranda, response memos, transmittal letters, and maps

This series documents the issuance and monitoring of general permits. This series includes, but is not limited to: standard specifications and approval, memoranda of understanding, general permits, annual reports, monthly reports, and audits
retention_statement: 5 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents the issuance of waterworks operation permits. These records are retained until the facility is razed. This series may include, but is not limited to: permit applications, operation permits, waterworks description sheets, variances, exemptions, invalidation and revocation letters. 32.1-172

This series documents the milestones in the approval process for waterworks' reports and projects. This series may include, but is not limited to: project name, project type or classification, engineer name, project status, actions, and related dates for approval process.

This series documents the reporting of educational including water source, detected contaminants, and compliance to the public. This series may include, but is not limited to: CCR report, certification, public notifications, letters, comment letters, and review notes

This series documents interaction with federal agencies regarding technical issues required to establish primacy in Virginia and operate a public water system program for the commonwealth. This series may include, but is not limited to: inventory; violation and enforcement data to the Safe Drinking Water Information System / Federal System (SDWIS/FED); Surface Water Treatment Rule (SWTR) data; Operator Certification Program annual reports; and annual capacity development implementation reports for new and existing systems

series_title: Reports: New Source or System Evaluation
series_description: This series documents the evaluation of new drinking water sources and potential waterworks. This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, questionnaires, records of Preliminary Engineering Conferences (PECs), evaluations, site inspection reports, and findings or recommendations.

This series documents the operational reporting and of waterworks' samples to ensure the waterworks facility is in compliance with the Virginia Waterworks Regulations and National Primary Drinking Water (NPDW) regulations. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports detailing monthly, daily, and average water production; population and number of connections served; and daily chlorine residuals distribution systems

series_title: Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA): Facility Closed or Records Superseded
series_description: This series documents approved monitoring plans, regulatory determinations, special evaluations, and vulnerability determinations. These records are retained until they are superseded or the facility closes. This series may include, but not limited to: approval letters, monitoring plans, waivers, reports, drawings, supporting data, monitoring decisions, Total Coliform Rule (TCR) monitoring decisions, maps, Lead and Copper Rule (LCR) material survey and sample pool reports, cross connection control plans, waterworks business operation plans, Groundwater Under the Direct Influence of Surface (GUDI) evaluations, and review notes

series_title: Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS) State
series_description: This series documents the tracking of waterworks facilities through the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS). This series may include, but is not limited to: sampling data, compliance status, violations, inspection schedules, and Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) dates. This series does not sample results, compliance schedules, or legal entities, which are covered by other series in this retention schedule

This series documents the routine inspections and evaluations of a waterworks' facility, water source, operation, and maintenance. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, reports, photographs of facilities, and documentation of other surveys and site visits, including up surveys and technical assistance visits

This series documents the regulation of public drinking water and provision of public education on the source of drinking water in each public water system, as required by the Source Water Assessment Program (SWAP). This series may include, but is not limited to: program details and final assessments to the waterworks, correspondence to owners with findings, photographs, maps, public service announcements, drawings, geological information, and potential sources of contamination in inventories and summaries.
retention_statement: 0 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents efforts to prevent pollution of rivers, lakes, streams, and groundwater that serve as a supply of public drinking water. This series may include, but is not to: technical advice, plans, and reports.
retention_statement: 0 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded
